intro: Manettia spuria, commonly known as the slender manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four to five petals, and are often clustered in inflorescences. Manettia spuria is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
